This needs Wedge to work, which i wouldn't have known about without this extension. 
Basically, Wedge will redirect searches to chrome, but it'll still be Bing. 
This extension then intercepts those searches and changes it to Google.

Not working for you in 2020? 
THE FIX:
Pretty sure Win10-2004 broke Edge Deflector again, so that the instructions don't work (no popup asking you which default application to choose).
I looked through the "Choose Default applications by protocol" list and found one entry that let me change the default from Edge to Edge Deflector:
MICROSOFT-EDGE
URL:microsoft-edge

and now my searches with Winkey open in Chrome with Google Search!! (I have Chrometana Pro installed also)
HTH, Tim
tnx for make my cortana to google

then choosing THAT as the default browser when prompted to when clicking a web result in the Windows Search Bar for the first time. It still searches and produces results using Bing in the Windows Menu along with the "open results in browser" and Bing Logo, however it opens Chrome when clicking on any result.

Works perfectly. Just a note for everybody: if you are not prompted with what program to open Cortana searches (if you have this issue, you know what I mean), from the "Default apps" window, scroll down and open "Set defaults by app". Then search for "Microsoft Edge" and hit the "Manage" button. Select the entry that is identified by:
MICROSOFT-EDGE
URL:microsoft-edge
Now hit on the related "Microsoft Edge" icon and select "EdgeDeflector" from the drop-down list.
Exit and that's really it!

This extention works exactly as advertised. Please note that you need to install an additional application, EdgeDeflector, to get all functionality. Instructions are shown after the extention is installed. I am happy that all future searches in the Windows start menu (Cortana) are not handled by Google Chrome and Google Search, yielding much better results than with Bing. Bing might be good in the USA, but overseas (EU) it isn't good at all.
This extension (with Edge Deflector of course) was extremely easy to install and use! No downside to using it.

Ok, first off, if you're using a RECENT version of Windows 10 the Edge Deflector is no longer required. Since Edge UWP is being retired, Cortana is now sending search requests to an installed copy of Microsoft Edge Chromium (or possibly normal Chromium, I don't use normal Chrome so I'm unsure) by default. This makes the Edge Deflector superfluous and un-needed now.

Other than that, it does what it says on the tin, any bing.com search requests get rewritten for Google's search engine, just li... Show more

To those of you who somehow didn't catch the memo, EdgeDeflector is what pushes Cortana to use Google Chrome instead of Edge. The extension only has the ability to force Cortana-based Bing searches to use Google Search instead. The project is open source, so you can check for malware yourself -- but keep in mind it's older than this extension and they are intended to work together.
